subject: Climate & Environment
title: Air Pollution and Lung Disease
description: A micro-lesson that makes Air Pollution and Lung Disease usable.

hook.text: A person in New Delhi breathes the equivalent of smoking 10 cigarettes a day just from the air.

buildup.text: Fine particles lodge deep in lung tissue, causing inflammation that never fully heals.

discovery.text: Chronic exposure leads to COPD, asthma, and lung cancer even in people who never smoked.

twist.text: Children's lungs develop until age 18. Pollution during those years causes permanent damage.

climax.text: Air pollution is the world's largest environmental health risk â€” bigger than unsafe water.

punchline.text: Breathing shouldn't be a health risk. For billions, it is.

quiz.question: Why are children especially vulnerable to air pollution?
